evidence: Clear separation of concerns with distinct modules: cli, main, parser, variables, ipython
Each module has a single responsibility and well-defined interface
Internal APIs are used consistently across modules (e.g., main imports from parser and variables)
Presence of __init__.py indicates package structure with controlled exports
Tests are organized per module, indicating modular testing approach
Low package count (2) but high avg_fan_out (4.47) suggests internal module dependencies rather than service boundaries
No evidence of network-based service communication or multiple deployable units
risks: High fan-out could indicate tight coupling between modules
Single package structure may not scale well for larger applications
No explicit layering patterns visible in the code organization
